SuChe

GET IN TOUCH

Year

2017

Location

Liverpool,UK

Tags

Service design, Customer experience, Branding

Black bottle

To level up with their competitors, a delivery services company in the UK wanted to create exemplary experiences for their end customers and align as an organisation to deliver their parcels efficiently.

Problem

The delivery services company wanted to Launch a premium service for a new segment of clients, Clients who would require excess amounts of care.

Field Research

To get an insider view of the service the delivery company is providing, we went on a visit to their Service center and on the road delivering parcels to homes.

Experience Mapping

We started with the experiences we wanted to create for the end customers and mapped out the channels & touch points by which the customers would interact with the service.

Tell a story

The best way to explain the experiences that we wanted to create is by telling them stories using storyboards.

Service Mapping

We figured out the set of activities that are needed to create the experience for the end customer to create the service design blue print that can be used to execute the service.

Task prioritisation & Execution

The list of activities created formed tasks to be executed to bring the service to the market. The tasks were then prioritised, tracked and tested. By partnering with a client who was ready to experiment, the service was executed. This helped us in building the service within the context of use and also gave us ample space to test and learn.
